page.title: 13 High Trees Farmhouse.
page.content: Group of farmhouse buildings.Wyre Forest grade 2(1958).Recently retiled. No trace of timber framed tithe barn once opposite.Earliest parts-c.hall & w.crosswing.Hall-lower close oak fram- ing preserved.Straight diagonal braces on crosswalls.Ceiling timbers,300x225mm crossed main beams with"ovolo"mouldings &"run-out"chamfer-stops.Joints pegged & marked with carpenter's numbering.Oak scroll brackets,probably Elizabethan, support the front & rear bearings of main crossbeam.Upper floors on w cross- wing originally jettied with dragon beams.Rear gable-small blocked original mullioned window.Upper centre-square frame panels with curved cusping braces 1611-rear gable timber.Ground floor oak panelling from another building-room used as chapel until early this century Roof profiles suggest complete oak str- uctures.Diagonal flue-stacks east wing.
